revised_title: Spherical Resonator with Circular Aperture: Period and Wave-Length Determination
tldr: The authors examine the period and wave-length of a spherical resonator with a circular aperture, building upon Lord Rayleigh's work on the Helmholtz resonator. They provide a second approximation for the wave-length determination and discuss the behavior of iron under minimal magnetic force. This study contributes to understanding the fundamental vibrations of spherical vessels and their applications in acoustics.
